decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).

The Local Planning Authority consider it essential that the whole of the development is carried out and that no departure whatsoever is made from the details approved, since the development would not necessarily be acceptable if partly carried out or carried out differently in any degree from the details submitted.  Also, in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.
There shall be no burning of waste products on the site at any time.
In order to protect the amenity of the area.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 the use hereby permitted shall be for the stabling of 2 horses and a goat only and shall be used for no other purpose(s) whatsoever, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area and to enable the Local Planning Authority to exercise control over any future use not forming part of this application, and that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policies DC45 and DC61.

The use of the building for which planning permission is hereby granted shall only enure for the benefit of the occupiers of No.2 Shepherds Hill and not for any other person unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local PLanning Authority.

To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area and to enable the Local Planning Authority to exercise control over any future use not forming part of this application.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework July 2021.
description: Retrospective planning permission for outbuilding as equestrian stables
